question: Scientists and technology experts seem to be more valued by modern society than musicians and artists. To what extent do you agree?
text: Nowadays, many societies believe that the rewarding for technology specialists is higher than musicians and artists. From my point of view, I agree with this statement for many reasons. In the following essay, the reasons to support my opinion will be outlined in detail.

To begin with, it is obvious that we live in the computer age, revolution is always happening. Since globalization needs technology to drive forward in every industry sector. The position of the technologist is noticeable to devise cutting-edge innovation for leisurely living for the world population. Moreover, the graduates from the science field are limited, these occupations are required in many organizations, for example, technology companies, advanced industrial manufacturers, and medical companies. As a result, the income for people in these fields is tremendously high.

After that, technology replaces many occupations within a decade. Many jobs are disrupted by artificial intelligence such as vehicle drivers, receptionists, and teachers. Although art and music are used to heal many patients by therapists in terms of mental illness, they will be replaced by artificial intelligence as well since the masterpieces in music and art can be created by artificial intelligence referred to famous art in the past. It is undeniable that technology takes a significant role to modernize our world, and it is indispensable in the near future.
In conclusion, I strongly agree with this viewpoint since it seems to me that societies are given more interest in technologists and scientists than artists and musicians during the computer age.
